title: MySQLPOWER()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLPOWER()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Return 4 raised to the second power:
SELECT POWER(4, 2);

Definition and Usage
The POWER() function returns the value of a number raised to the power of 
another number.
Note:
This function is equal to the
POW()
function.
Syntax
POWER(
x, y
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
x
Required. A number (the base)
y
Required. A number (the exponent)
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Return 8 raised to the third power:
SELECT POWER(8, 3);

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLPOWER()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLPOWER()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLPOWER()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
